title: The God of the Woods
author: Liz Moore
alttext: The cover image of The God of the Woods, includes forest background with a pink drip
About: This was a interesting read for me because it dealt with a lot of important issues surrounding the 1950-1970s. As well as having a mystery intertwined with family issues.

title: A Good Girl's Guide to Murder
author: Holly Jackson
alttext: The cover includes pins and red string and a quote 'A closed case. An A grade student who wont let it go...'
About: Since this book was turned into a TV show, I wanted to read it before watching. Really love young adult books and this one was so fun. Loved pips determination to find the killer.

title: The Naturals
author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes
alttext: The cover includes a black box wrapped in police caution tape
About: I heard this book was described as criminal minds but with teenagers and I immediately bought the series. I love mysteries and this was the perfect easy read.

title: Killer Instinct
author: Jennifer Lynn Barnes
alttext: The cover includes a King of spades card with a shooting target in the middle
About: This is the second book in the Natural series and it was just as good. I am interested to learn more about the 'side characters' and how they got involved with the program.

title: Happy Place
author: Emily Henry
alttext: The cover includes 4 people jumping into water with 2 other people sitting in floaties
About: My second Emily Henry book, but the first I enjoyed. Reading about Harriet and Wyn was very intriguing and it was beautifully written.

title: Queen of Shadows
author: Sarah J. Maas
alttext: The cover includes a rocky mountain with a castle at the top
About: The 4th book in 'Throne of Glass', and the story keeps getting better with every book. I Love learning more about Manon and the ending was so crazy!

title: Six Scorched Roses
author: Carissa Broadbent
alttext: The cover includes two hands grabbing a rose
About: A fun novella for the 'Crown of Nyaxia' series and it was the first novella ive read that was interesting! Cute love story that gives introduction to characters in the 2nd book.

title: Heir of Fire
author: Sarah J. Maas
alttext: The cover includes a dragon flying in-between trees
About: My absolute favorite book so far in the 'Throne of Glass' series. Love the new characters and the new relationships forming. I am starting to see why this series is so popular.

title: People We Meet on Vacation
author: Emily Henry
alttext: The cover includes two people laying in beach chairs
About: I started this book right before school and I have had no time to read :( but I need to finish this book before the movie comes out!

title: The Fifth Season
author: N.K. Jemisin
alttext: The cover includes a stone wall with stone designs
About: This book was recommended to me by a friend and I am wanting to read a 'higher' fantasy book so I am excited for this series!

title: Daisy Haites
author: Jessa Hastings
alttext: The cover includes a cross, the flag of Italy, guns, tigers, all displayed as a collage on top of daisies
About: This is the second book in the Magnolia Parks series and I really enjoyed the first one and I am excited to read this one. I love the cover on it as well, its very unique.

title: The Secret History
author: Donna Tartt
alttext: The cover includes a stone carved face
About: I've had this recommended by a friend and recently got a copy to read. It is a dark academia mystery, so I have very intrigued.

title: Mistborn
author: Brandon Sanderson
alttext: The cover includes a person flying upward and two people angerly looking at the person
About: If you know fantasy you know Brandon Sanderson. He has written more books than my age times 3. He is known in the fantasy realm and I am very excited to one day find the courage to start reading his books. This is the recommended starting book.

title: Misery
author: Stephen King
alttext: The cover includes a person looking through a ripped piece of paper with writing on it
About: I have never read a Stephan King novel and I randomly picked this book on a whim. Stephen Kind scares me a little bit to be honest, but regardless I feel the need to read one book of his.

title: Masters of Death
author: Olivie Blake
alttext: The cover includes a skeleton standing on a stick that two hands are holding
About: This is a book where the cover drew me in. I have never read a book by her, but have heard great things. I am excited to read this one day.

title: Vicious
author: V.E. Schwab
alttext: The cover includes bones scattered in the shape of a triangle leading up to a person standing in the distance
About: This is a book I am really excited to find time to read. I have heard nothing but great things from V.E. Schwab and her magic books. This has to do with good vs evil and the good guys who might not be good guys, which is not a topic I read about much.

title: Juniper and Thorn
author: Ava Reid
alttext: The cover includes a person looking through branches and a snake wrapping around the branches
About: This book is a gothic horror retelling of Juniper Tree, which initially drew me in. I don't read a lot of horror books so I am excited to read this one day.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
alttext: The cover includes an owl with a letter in its mouth, standing on lightening
About: I put this under reread because when I was younger I only read the first 3 books because the ones after that were  'too long' according to younger me. So, since my grandparents own all of them I would love to eventually reread/read them all.

title: Legend
author: Marie Lu
alttext: The cover includes a mark/symbol that has a star on top of a symbol.
About: This was one of the first book series I fell in love with in middle school. It was the perfect dystopian book for me and I love to read it to this day. It is just perfect

title: House of Salt and Sorrows
author: Erin A. Craig
alttext: The cover includes a tide pool with starfish and tentacles in the water
About: Another horror book that cover drew me in. I believe it is a twist on the twelve dancing princesses fairytale, which was my favorite Barbie movie. So I had to pick it up, and want to read the series one day.
